TopicTitle: Landing gear goes wonky after re-deploying in flight

Articles.Content:
Has anyone else had this issue with planes' gears going crazy after being retracted and then re-deployed? It seems to happen on many of my builds and I figured I would (finally) make a post about it.

Pre-Flight: Deployed Landing Gear

 

In-Flight: Deployed Landing Gear

 

In-Flight: Retracted Landing Gear

 

In-Flight: Re-Deployed Landing Gear

 

In-Flight: Re-Deployed Landing Gear (Second Angle)

Hi there. I'm wondering if your landing gear is close to a join( two parts connect) and when you take off and fly the stress on the vehicle is causing things to shift. It's only a guess but sometimes when when attaching landing gear, as you go up and down the vehicle they can flip round in the wrong direction. I tend to keep them away from a joint and strut the part well that has landing gear.

When I've built planes and they tend to suddenly veer off on takeoff, strutting the part that has the front landing gear usually fixes this. You may not see the movement but it's there.

This is really only a guess though as I've not had this problem

I take it they were attached in symmetry?

Hello! The gears are in symmetry mode connected to the fuel tank near the rear. The gears are clipped a bit into the fuel tanks which I'm sure can cause some weird behavior but it's as if the gears decided to go into a mirror mode or steer 180 degrees somehow after being deployed again (the brake lights seem to still be on back of each gear too as they should)

Edited June 17, 2023 by Madishmike

I've sussed it

I recreated your craft and sure enough had the same issue. Sometimes it's one that reverts and also had both reverse. Worked out that the top of the gear at the back was clipping on the rear engines that had been pulled in. Run this a few times so confident that's what it is. Also found SAS made this worse as the engines are wiggling seemed to upset it more. Either pull the engines out a bit or slightly move landing gear forward.
